ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Great development of my German speaking and writing abilities

I really enjoyed the way this course was taught. I improved my practical German skills and learned (and re-learned) a lot of grammar. I also learned about German culture, especially because of the way our textbook was set up.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the course uses a variety of methods quite well, including conversation, video, worksheets etc. I also liked how we had very frequent exams which made them much less stressful and easier to study for. I think one major improvement would be to have vocabulary lists. I think learning vocabulary more systematically would've expanded my knowledge of the language more dramatically than trying to learn it organically. And although this method makes me internalize the words more, I still find myself needing words that don't know when I am trying to speak.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I think this is a very well organized and fun language course. Definitely worth taking if you know some/have been taking German.
